Token.Abstract: PINMemoryCache is a fast, thread safe key/value store similar to NSCache. On iOS it will clear itself automatically to reduce memory usage when the app receives a memory warning or goes into the background.
A concurrent queue on which all callbacks are called. It is exposed here so that it can be set to target some other queue, such as a global concurrent queue with a priority other than the default.
A concurrent queue on which all callbacks are called. It is exposed here so that it can be set to target some other queue, such as a global concurrent queue with a priority other than the default.
A concurrent queue on which all callbacks are called. It is exposed here so that it can be set to target some other queue, such as a global concurrent queue with a priority other than the default.
The total accumulated cost.
The total accumulated cost.
The total accumulated cost.
The maximum cost allowed to accumulate before objects begin to be removed with trimToCostByDate:.
The maximum cost allowed to accumulate before objects begin to be removed with trimToCostByDate:.
The maximum cost allowed to accumulate before objects begin to be removed with trimToCostByDate:.

The maximum number of seconds an object is allowed to exist in the cache. Setting this to a value greater than 0.0 will start a recurring GCD timer with the same period that calls trimToDate:. Setting it back to 0.0 will stop the timer. Defaults to 0.0.

The maximum number of seconds an object is allowed to exist in the cache. Setting this to a value greater than 0.0 will start a recurring GCD timer with the same period that calls trimToDate:. Setting it back to 0.0 will stop the timer. Defaults to 0.0.

The maximum number of seconds an object is allowed to exist in the cache. Setting this to a value greater than 0.0 will start a recurring GCD timer with the same period that calls trimToDate:. Setting it back to 0.0 will stop the timer. Defaults to 0.0.

If ttlCache is YES, the cache behaves like a ttlCache. This means that once an object enters the cache, it only lives as long as self.ageLimit. This has the following implications: - Accessing an object in the cache does not extend that object's lifetime in the cache - When attempting to access an object in the cache that has lived longer than self.ageLimit, the cache will behave as if the object does not exist

If ttlCache is YES, the cache behaves like a ttlCache. This means that once an object enters the cache, it only lives as long as self.ageLimit. This has the following implications: - Accessing an object in the cache does not extend that object's lifetime in the cache - When attempting to access an object in the cache that has lived longer than self.ageLimit, the cache will behave as if the object does not exist

If ttlCache is YES, the cache behaves like a ttlCache. This means that once an object enters the cache, it only lives as long as self.ageLimit. This has the following implications: - Accessing an object in the cache does not extend that object's lifetime in the cache - When attempting to access an object in the cache that has lived longer than self.ageLimit, the cache will behave as if the object does not exist
When YES on iOS the cache will remove all objects when the app receives a memory warning. Defaults to YES.
When YES on iOS the cache will remove all objects when the app receives a memory warning. Defaults to YES.
When YES on iOS the cache will remove all objects when the app receives a memory warning. Defaults to YES.
When YES on iOS the cache will remove all objects when the app enters the background. Defaults to YES.
When YES on iOS the cache will remove all objects when the app enters the background. Defaults to YES.
When YES on iOS the cache will remove all objects when the app enters the background. Defaults to YES.

A block to be executed just before an object is added to the cache. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed just before an object is added to the cache. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed just before an object is added to the cache. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed just before an object is removed from the cache. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed just before an object is removed from the cache. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed just before an object is removed from the cache. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed just before all objects are removed from the cache as a result of removeAllObjects:. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed just before all objects are removed from the cache as a result of removeAllObjects:. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed just before all objects are removed from the cache as a result of removeAllObjects:. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed just after an object is added to the cache. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed just after an object is added to the cache. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed just after an object is added to the cache. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed just after an object is removed from the cache. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed just after an object is removed from the cache. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed just after an object is removed from the cache. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed just after all objects are removed from the cache as a result of removeAllObjects:. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed just after all objects are removed from the cache as a result of removeAllObjects:. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed just after all objects are removed from the cache as a result of removeAllObjects:. This block will be excuted within a lock, i.e. all reads and writes are suspended for the duration of the block. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

A block to be executed upon receiving a memory warning (iOS only) potentially in parallel with other blocks on the <queue>. This block will be executed regardless of the value of removeAllObjectsOnMemoryWarning. Defaults to nil.

A block to be executed upon receiving a memory warning (iOS only) potentially in parallel with other blocks on the <queue>. This block will be executed regardless of the value of removeAllObjectsOnMemoryWarning. Defaults to nil.

A block to be executed upon receiving a memory warning (iOS only) potentially in parallel with other blocks on the <queue>. This block will be executed regardless of the value of removeAllObjectsOnMemoryWarning. Defaults to nil.

A block to be executed when the app enters the background (iOS only) potentially in parallel with other blocks on the concurrentQueue. This block will be executed regardless of the value of removeAllObjectsOnEnteringBackground. Defaults to nil.

A block to be executed when the app enters the background (iOS only) potentially in parallel with other blocks on the concurrentQueue. This block will be executed regardless of the value of removeAllObjectsOnEnteringBackground. Defaults to nil.

A block to be executed when the app enters the background (iOS only) potentially in parallel with other blocks on the concurrentQueue. This block will be executed regardless of the value of removeAllObjectsOnEnteringBackground. Defaults to nil.
A shared cache.

This method determines whether an object is present for the given key in the cache. This method returns immediately and executes the passed block after the object is available, potentially in parallel with other blocks on the concurrentQueue.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: The key associated with the object.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: A block to be executed concurrently after the containment check happened

Token.Abstract: Retrieves the object for the specified key. This method returns immediately and executes the passed block after the object is available, potentially in parallel with other blocks on the concurrentQueue.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: The key associated with the requested object.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: A block to be executed concurrently when the object is available.

Token.Abstract: Stores an object in the cache for the specified key. This method returns immediately and executes the passed block after the object has been stored, potentially in parallel with other blocks on the concurrentQueue.

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: An object to store in the cache.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: A key to associate with the object. This string will be copied.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: A block to be executed concurrently after the object has been stored, or nil.

Token.Abstract: Stores an object in the cache for the specified key and the specified cost. If the cost causes the total to go over the costLimit the cache is trimmed (oldest objects first). This method returns immediately and executes the passed block after the object has been stored, potentially in parallel with other blocks on the concurrentQueue.

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: An object to store in the cache.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: A key to associate with the object. This string will be copied.

Parameter.Name: cost
Parameter.Abstract: An amount to add to the totalCost.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: A block to be executed concurrently after the object has been stored, or nil.

Token.Abstract: Removes the object for the specified key. This method returns immediately and executes the passed block after the object has been removed, potentially in parallel with other blocks on the concurrentQueue.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: The key associated with the object to be removed.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: A block to be executed concurrently after the object has been removed, or nil.

Token.Abstract: Removes all objects from the cache that have not been used since the specified date. This method returns immediately and executes the passed block after the cache has been trimmed, potentially in parallel with other blocks on the concurrentQueue.

Parameter.Name: date
Parameter.Abstract: Objects that haven't been accessed since this date are removed from the cache.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: A block to be executed concurrently after the cache has been trimmed, or nil.

Token.Abstract: Removes objects from the cache, costliest objects first, until the totalCost is below the specified value. This method returns immediately and executes the passed block after the cache has been trimmed, potentially in parallel with other blocks on the concurrentQueue.

Parameter.Name: cost
Parameter.Abstract: The total accumulation allowed to remain after the cache has been trimmed.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: A block to be executed concurrently after the cache has been trimmed, or nil.

Token.Abstract: Removes objects from the cache, ordered by date (least recently used first), until the totalCost is below the specified value. This method returns immediately and executes the passed block after the cache has been trimmed, potentially in parallel with other blocks on the concurrentQueue.

Parameter.Name: cost
Parameter.Abstract: The total accumulation allowed to remain after the cache has been trimmed.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: A block to be executed concurrently after the cache has been trimmed, or nil.

Token.Abstract: Removes all objects from the cache. This method returns immediately and executes the passed block after the cache has been cleared, potentially in parallel with other blocks on the concurrentQueue.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: A block to be executed concurrently after the cache has been cleared, or nil.

Token.Abstract: Loops through all objects in the cache with reads and writes suspended. Calling serial methods which write to the cache inside block may be unsafe and may result in a deadlock. This method returns immediately.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: A block to be executed for every object in the cache.

Parameter.Name: completionBlock
Parameter.Abstract: An optional block to be executed concurrently when the enumeration is complete.

Token.Abstract: This method determines whether an object is present for the given key in the cache.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: The key associated with the object.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if an object is present for the given key in the cache, otherwise NO.

Token.Abstract: Retrieves the object for the specified key. This method blocks the calling thread until the object is available.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: The key associated with the object.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The object for the specified key.

Token.Abstract: Stores an object in the cache for the specified key. This method blocks the calling thread until the object has been set.

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: An object to store in the cache.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: A key to associate with the object. This string will be copied.

Token.Abstract: Stores an object in the cache for the specified key and the specified cost. If the cost causes the total to go over the costLimit the cache is trimmed (oldest objects first). This method blocks the calling thread until the object has been stored.

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: An object to store in the cache.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: A key to associate with the object. This string will be copied.

Parameter.Name: cost
Parameter.Abstract: An amount to add to the totalCost.

Token.Abstract: Removes the object for the specified key. This method blocks the calling thread until the object has been removed.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: The key associated with the object to be removed.

Token.Abstract: Removes all objects from the cache that have not been used since the specified date. This method blocks the calling thread until the cache has been trimmed.

Parameter.Name: date
Parameter.Abstract: Objects that haven't been accessed since this date are removed from the cache.

Token.Abstract: Removes objects from the cache, costliest objects first, until the totalCost is below the specified value. This method blocks the calling thread until the cache has been trimmed.

Parameter.Name: cost
Parameter.Abstract: The total accumulation allowed to remain after the cache has been trimmed.

Token.Abstract: Removes objects from the cache, ordered by date (least recently used first), until the totalCost is below the specified value. This method blocks the calling thread until the cache has been trimmed.

Parameter.Name: cost
Parameter.Abstract: The total accumulation allowed to remain after the cache has been trimmed.

Token.Abstract: Removes all objects from the cache. This method blocks the calling thread until the cache has been cleared.

Loops through all objects in the cache within a memory lock (reads and writes are suspended during the enumeration). This method blocks the calling thread until all objects have been enumerated. Calling synchronous methods on the cache within this callback will likely cause a deadlock.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: A block to be executed for every object in the cache.
